content:
Diagnosis:		Bladder cancer - lipid-rich variant urothelial carcinoma

Management:		12 Mar 2024 TURBT with complete resection

Histology:		pT3a N0 lipid-rich variant urothelial carcinoma
		BAP1 loss on immunohistochemistry
		Lymphovascular invasion present

Current Situation:	Post-operative assessment for adjuvant treatment

[redacted name] attended clinic today following recent TURBT. She has recovered well from surgery with minimal urinary symptoms now resolved. No haematuria. Performance status 0. Recent staging CT thorax/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of metastatic disease. Blood tests including renal function are satisfactory.

I have discussed adjuvant chemotherapy given the T3a staging and presence of lymphovascular invasion. We will proceed with 4 cycles of Gemcitabine-Cisplatin. Treatment to commence in 2 weeks following dental assessment. Follow-up cystoscopy arranged for 3 months. Written information provided regarding chemotherapy side effects and contact numbers.
